comments:
I am sometimes seeing unexpected SetData callbacks on GTK, see stacktrace below.  When this happens, it seems as if the whole tree gets materialized.

To reproduce, run the snippet from bug 172640 against JFace from HEAD, expand all nodes in the tree, select item "child 4/A" and click on Sort several times.

callback for TreeItem {element 1} at 1
java.lang.Exception: Stack trace
	at java.lang.Thread.dumpStack(Thread.java:1103)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer$2.handleEvent(TreeViewer.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1097)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1121)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1106)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.checkData(Tree.java:317)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.cellDataProc(Tree.java:252)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.cellDataProc(Display.java:677)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._gtk_main_do_event(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.gtk_main_do_event(OS.java:5583)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.eventProc(Display.java:1171)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._gtk_tree_view_set_cursor(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.gtk_tree_view_set_cursor(OS.java:8564)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.setSelection(Tree.java:2885)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.setSelection(TreeViewer.java:330)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.setSelectionToWidget(AbstractTreeViewer.java:2353)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.setSelectionToWidget(AbstractTreeViewer.java:2726)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1370)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.preservingSelection(TreeViewer.java:379)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1325)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1426)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1385)
	at foo.Snippet172640$1.widgetSelected(Snippet172640.java:232)
What is "unexpected"?  SetData callbacks can come at any time.
Yes, they can come at any time, but in this case I got callbacks for every item in the tree (about 30% were visible).
SSQ, this was the bug that is on your white board.
